column4: I just set up a samba file share on my home directory however when i try to connect from windows it doesn't accept my password and it tries to put a domain in front of the username, what should that domain be(or did I screw something up)
sudo smbpasswd -a username
I did that
I can see the machine in my workgroup, but I can't seem to authenticate
did you create a samba password for your user?
Yep
webserv is the hostname?
yeah
Nope :(
check your /etc/samba/smb.conf, check to see if theres a line that says: security = user, change it to security = share
Done, I can now connect to \\webserv but there aren't any files in there
did u make a change in smb.conf? if u did you have to: sudo /etc/init.d/samba restart
Yeah, I did both before I tried to connect
check the share definition in smb.conf and make sure it has the option available = yes
I don't have an available option in here anywhere
type it in there
Nothing
put guestok = yes under that share definition
Nope
are the server and client in the same workgroup?
Yeah
